title: Randi Rhodes Show - October 10 2013
description:
October 10, 2013
The Randi Rhodes Show 


Republicans seem to be slowly and carefully backing away from their demands about the debt ceiling and Obamacare. I think they finally realized that those demands were going to blow up in their faces. Now, if nothing else, at least theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re trying to shield their faces. Now he just has to find a way to allow Republicans to tell their base that they didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t lose.

Now the Republicans have a new strategy... or at least, a new way of approaching the fact that they donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have a strategy. Republicans are offering a plan for a very temporary increase in the debt ceiling. In other words, they reserve the right to engage in hostage taking in the future... and the near future, at that. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not clear how long a debt ceiling increase would be. Republicans have mentioned things like 4 to 6 weeks. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not increasing the debt ceiling, thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s merely propping up the debt ceiling. A short-term debt limit increase! Thanks guysÃ¢â‚¬â€youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re offering to trade a state of acute crisis for a state of chronic crisis. They also want to concentrate on continuing the government shutdown. I think thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the RepublicansÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ idea of compromiseÃ¢â‚¬â€they wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t keep the government going, but theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re willing to keep the government shutdown going.

For them to try and step away from it is like water trying to disassociate itself from a flood. If the Koch brothers and Heritage are saying that the debt ceiling shouldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be tied to defunding Obamacare, then what theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re really saying is that it just didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t work.

Republican Congressman Markwayne Mullin has issued a call for all FOUR branches of the government to work together. Hey, Markwayne is a guy who forgot to leave a space between his two first names. Mullin is quoted as saying Ã¢â‚¬Å“This country isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t ran by just one individual itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ran by four branches, but three branches that are in control of this.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ What?!? If thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the actual quote, then Mullin getting the wrong number of branches is the least of his problems!
